meanings.definition: Tending to eliminate or get rid of something.
meanings.sent1: The eliminative approach helped reduce waste in the factory.
meanings.sent2: The cleaner used an eliminative spray to remove the stain.
meanings.sent3: The eliminative mindset of the team led to a clutter-free workspace.
meanings.sent4: Her eliminative actions towards negativity cleared the path for positivity.
meanings.sent5: The eliminative power of the vacuum cleaner sucked up all the dirt.

meanings.definition: Involving the process of removing or eradicating something.
meanings.sent1: The eliminative surgery successfully removed the tumor.
meanings.sent2: The exterminator used an eliminative method to get rid of the pests.
meanings.sent3: The eliminative strategy of the army wiped out the enemy forces.
meanings.sent4: Her eliminative decision to cut ties with toxic people improved her mental health.
meanings.sent5: The eliminative process of decluttering her room made it more spacious.
